Chicago Fire: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas. With Jesse Spencer, Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker. The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q1MDhjYzQtZmNmYS00ZmUyLWFmYjgtZTkyMzU0ZjcyMDNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0817980/","name":"Jesse Spencer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""},"datePublished":"2012-10-10","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sfcat"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really enjoyed","reviewBody":"Wasn't perfect but no pilot is. Really enjoyed the show, we found it exciting, fast paced, without too much exposition or clumsy explaining. Liked what felt like some fairly realistic situations, hope they give the chance.

Loved seeing Eamonn Walker. he was a favorite actor I hope they give him a good chance to shine.

My only concern with an ensemble cast is not getting enough character development and interest to keep the show going at the beginning before it gets to sink in and develop a stable audience.

And really enjoyed seeing something set in somewhere other than New York or Los Angeles!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8}}</script><metacontent="

Really enjoyed the show, we found it exciting, fast paced, without too much exposition or clumsy explaining. Liked what felt like some fairly realistic situations, hope they give the chance.

Loved seeing Eamonn Walker. he was a favorite actor I hope they give him a good chance to shine.

My only concern with an ensemble cast is not getting enough character development and interest to keep the show going at the beginning before it gets to sink in and develop a stable audience.

And really enjoyed seeing something set in somewhere other than New York or Los Angeles!!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8</script><metacontent="

The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q1MDhjYzQtZmNmYS00ZmUyLWFmYjgtZTkyMzU0ZjcyMDNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0817980/","name":"Jesse Spencer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire."","datePublished":"2012-10-10","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sfcat","dateCreated":"2012-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really enjoyed","reviewBody":"Wasn't perfect but no pilot is. Really enjoyed the show, we found it exciting, fast paced, without too much exposition or clumsy explaining. Liked what felt like some fairly realistic situations, hope they give the chance.

Loved seeing Eamonn Walker. he was a favorite actor I hope they give him a good chance to shine.

My only concern with an ensemble cast is not getting enough character development and interest to keep the show going at the beginning before it gets to sink in and develop a stable audience.

And really enjoyed seeing something set in somewhere other than New York or Los Angeles!!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Created by Shane Brennan. With Chris O'Donnell, Daniela Ruah, Barrett Foa, LL Cool J. Callen and Sam Hanna, streets kids risen through the ranks.

programme.desc: Created by Shane Brennan. With Chris O'Donnell, Daniela Ruah, Barrett Foa, LL Cool J. The Naval Criminal Investigation Service's Office of Special Projects takes on the undercover work and the hard to crack cases in LA. Key agents are G. Callen and Sam Hanna, streets kids risen through the ranks.

Really enjoyed the show, we found it exciting, fast paced, without too much exposition or clumsy explaining. Liked what felt like some fairly realistic situations, hope they give the chance.

Loved seeing Eamonn Walker. he was a favorite actor I hope they give him a good chance to shine.

My only concern with an ensemble cast is not getting enough character development and interest to keep the show going at the beginning before it gets to sink in and develop a stable audience.

And really enjoyed seeing something set in somewhere other than New York or Los Angeles!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8}}</script><metacontent="

The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q1MDhjYzQtZmNmYS00ZmUyLWFmYjgtZTkyMzU0ZjcyMDNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0817980/","name":"Jesse Spencer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire."","datePublished":"2012-10-10","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sfcat","dateCreated":"2012-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really enjoyed","reviewBody":"Wasn't perfect but no pilot is. Really enjoyed the show, we found it exciting, fast paced, without too much exposition or clumsy explaining. Liked what felt like some fairly realistic situations, hope they give the chance.

Loved seeing Eamonn Walker. he was a favorite actor I hope they give him a good chance to shine.

My only concern with an ensemble cast is not getting enough character development and interest to keep the show going at the beginning before it gets to sink in and develop a stable audience.

And really enjoyed seeing something set in somewhere other than New York or Los Angeles!!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8</script><metacontent="

programme.title: II koncert na wiolonczelę i orkiestrę
programme.desc: Cykl prezentujący wyselekcjonowany zbiór najlepszych filmów krótkometrażowych. Wiele z nich nagrodzonych zostało prestiżowymi wyróżnieniami na międzynarodowych galach i festiwalach filmowych. Każde pasmo przedstawia kilka produkcji na dany temat.

credits.actor: Alexander Karim, Malin Buska, Thomas Bo Larsen, Nicolaj Kopernikus, Johannes Lassen, Andre Christenson, Henning Valin Jakobsen, Sara Hjort Ditlevsen, Liv Mjönes
Alexander Karim, Malin Buska, Thomas Bo Larsen, Nicolaj Kopernikus, Johannes Lassen, Andre Christenson, Henning Valin Jakobsen, Sara Hjort Ditlevsen, Liv Mjönes

programme.title: Spitsbergen
programme.desc: Magda (Magdalena Czerwińska), zawieszona ratowniczka medyczna, otrzymuje nagłe wezwanie. Oznacza to dla niej powrót do dramatycznych wydarzeń i ludzkich tragedii. Gdy opada poziom adrenaliny, kobieta przypomina sobie podróże na Spitsbergen - mroźną norweską wyspę na Morzu Arktycznym. To miejsce stało się dla niej powodem traumy, z którą do tej pory nie zdołała się uporać. Przerastają ją cudze nieszczęścia i własna przeszłość.

programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: Kurs
programme.desc: Do taksówki znajdującej się na dworcu, wsiada pewien mężczyzna (Łukasz Nowicki). Początkowo luźna rozmowa między taksówkarzem (Grzegorz Kowalczyk) a pasażerem obiera inny tor. Tematy rozmów stają się coraz bardziej osobiste.

mill,lumber","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3922816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"anthonyjlangford"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Near flawless but not a ride for the faint of heart","reviewBody":"Much has been said already; slick direction, outstanding performances from the entire cast, especially those we are unfamiliar with on the screen and a brilliant story, 140 years old, that cements as the bed rock. (Rush is quite deliciously understated).

I only have two objections. The editing style is unique (dialogue preceding the scene, or carrying over other parts that is not natural but interesting). However I feel the director relies on it too heavily, passing up the potential for good drama. This is especially noticeable in a confrontation between Sam Neill and Geoffrey Rush. The tension is passed over in favour of technique. An error.

The other objection is that the director claims the play 'Inspires' the screenplay. Despite the changes, it's the same story. It should be 'based upon'. Its an obvious flex of ego.

Minor points aside, this a top notch, captivating drama in all regards, showing the complexities of human relations, and that truth is not always the right option. Ah, the intricate web we often unintentionally weave.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4909,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Niepospolita
programme.desc: Rok 1939. Pisarz Tadeusz Dołęga-Mostowicz (Patryk Szwichtenberg) podróżuje po Polsce ze swoją asystentką Dianą (Agata Różycka). Przeprowadza wywiady z ludźmi, którzy osiągnęli sukces w różnych dziedzinach. Na swojej drodze spotyka m.in. Melchiora Wańkowicza (Marek Karpowicz), Janusza Kusocińskiego, Eugeniusza Kwiatkowskiego i Hankę Ordonównę.

programme.title: Leonardo DiCaprio - droga do sławy
programme.desc: Sylwetka jednego z największych i najbardziej spełnionych artystów w świecie filmu. Leonardo DiCaprio zaczął grać w bardzo młodym wieku. Wystąpił m.in. w 'Co gryzie Gilberta Grape'a'.

programme.title: A Vida Invisível
Niewidoczne życie sióstr Gusmao
A Vida Invisível de Eurídice Gusmão
programme.desc:
A Vida Invisível: Directed by Karim Aïnouz. With Julia Stockler, Carol Duarte, Flávia Gusmão, António Fonseca. Kept apart by a terrible lie and a conservative society, two sisters born in Rio de Janeiro make their way through life each believing the other is living out her dreams half a world away." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6390668/","name":"A Vida Invisível","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4ZGExYTctMTRlZS00MzgzLWI1NTktYzk5ODkzOWNlZjc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkzODUwNzk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3126686/","name":"Julia Stockler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6706672/","name":"Carol Duarte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1411240/","name":"Flávia Gusmão"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0014694/","name":"Karim Aïnouz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0245671/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133296/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258481/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2675515/","name":"Murilo Hauser"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1972905/","name":"Inés Bortagaray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0014694/","name":"Karim Aïnouz"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3375480601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNhMDI1ZTYtNzU2Ny00NGIzLTlmN2MtYjg4OGY0MjUxNzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNhMDI1ZTYtNzU2Ny00NGIzLTlmN2MtYjg4OGY0MjUxNzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Rio de Janeiro, 1950. Eurídice, 18, and Guida, 20, are two inseparable sisters living at home with their conservative parents. Although immersed in a traditional life, each one nourishes a dream: Eurídice of becoming a renowned pianist, Guida of finding true love. In a dramatic turn, they are separated by their father and forced to live apart. They take control of their separate destinies, while never giving up hope of finding each other. A tropical melodrama from the director of Madame Satã."},"datePublished":"2019-11-21","description":"Kept apart by a terrible lie and a conservative society, two sisters born in Rio de Janeiro make their way through life each believing the other is living out her dreams half a world away.","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,erection,male explicit nudity,erect penis,uncircumcised penis","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6390668/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"the strength of separated sisters","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Masterful storytelling when combined with expert filmmaking is a treasure to be appreciated and enjoyed, even if the story is not so pleasant. Such is the case with this gem from writer-director Karim Ainouz, who adapted the screenplay with Murilo Hauser and Ines Bortagaray from the novel "The Invisible Life of Euridice Gusmao" by Martha Bathala. Based in Rio de Janiero, the film blends the vibrant colors of the area with the traditional and restrictive Latin American family expectations of the 1950's.

The story spans 5 or 6 decades, and when we first meet sisters Euridice and Guida, it's clear they share a tight emotional bond that goes deeper than blood. Though their personalities differ greatly, they are both ahead of their time and out of step with the conventions of the era. Euridice (a strong performance by Carol Duarte) longs for independence and aspires to be a concert pianist after a hoped-for Conservatory in Vienna, while Guida (a powerhouse Julia Stockler) is a dreamer seeking true love, and whose party girl ways must be kept hidden from their conservative father. Both young ladies are spirited, yet respectful.

Their lives are forever altered when Guida runs off to Greece with her sailor lover. As is too often the case with young dreamers, she returns home once her spontaneous choices prove to be poor judgment. Her father rejects his pregnant daughter since, in his eyes, she has disgraced the family. The parents mislead Guida about her sister's whereabouts, so Guida assumes Euridice is off at conservatory fulfilling her dreams. This sets Guida off on her own solitary path.

In actuality, Euridice has married and experienced one of the worst ever wedding nights, featuring what is likely cinema's most unsexy bathroom lovemaking scene. There is an element of horror films to this segment of the film, as the sisters are living their worst nightmares, while being separated from each other ... unable to communicate. The male-dominated Latin culture and family traditions prevent their mother from 'disobeying' the father's order, so the cruel lie continues as the sisters unknowingly live their lives within the same town. There is even one excruciatingly painful-to-watch scene that finds them in the same restaurant at the same time, yet oblivious to the presence of the other.

Each woman's inner-strength pushes them forward. Guida (now Gisele) befriends a wise former prostitute Filomena (an excellent Barbara Santos) who becomes her mentor in poverty. Euridice tries to make the best of her situation while keeping her dream alive. Mostly what we have is a tragic story without one specific tragedy - other than the daughter spurned by her father. There are so many moments of pain and frustration, with undelivered mail being among the worst. The film is beautifully shot by cinematographer Helene Louvart, and it reminds us that 'life happens', and it's not all love and Bach. This is an emotional and heart-breaking story, and devotees of The Lifetime Channel will likely be disappointed in the ending. For me, I have no qualms about the emotional wringer the film puts viewers through - even after the opening scene foreshadowing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6797,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

Eurídice, 18, and Guida, 20, are two inseparable sisters living at home with their conservative parents. Although immersed in a traditional life, each one nourishes a dream: Eurídice of becoming a renowned pianist, Guida of finding true love. In a dramatic turn, they are separated by their father and forced to live apart. They take control of their separate destinies, while never giving up hope of finding each other. A tropical melodrama from the director of Madame Satã.","datePublished":"2019-11-21","description":"Kept apart by a terrible lie and a conservative society, two sisters born in Rio de Janeiro make their way through life each believing the other is living out her dreams half a world away.","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,erection,male explicit nudity,erect penis,uncircumcised penis","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6390668/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6","dateCreated":"2020-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"the strength of separated sisters","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Masterful storytelling when combined with expert filmmaking is a treasure to be appreciated and enjoyed, even if the story is not so pleasant. Such is the case with this gem from writer-director Karim Ainouz, who adapted the screenplay with Murilo Hauser and Ines Bortagaray from the novel "The Invisible Life of Euridice Gusmao" by Martha Bathala. Based in Rio de Janiero, the film blends the vibrant colors of the area with the traditional and restrictive Latin American family expectations of the 1950's.

The story spans 5 or 6 decades, and when we first meet sisters Euridice and Guida, it's clear they share a tight emotional bond that goes deeper than blood. Though their personalities differ greatly, they are both ahead of their time and out of step with the conventions of the era. Euridice (a strong performance by Carol Duarte) longs for independence and aspires to be a concert pianist after a hoped-for Conservatory in Vienna, while Guida (a powerhouse Julia Stockler) is a dreamer seeking true love, and whose party girl ways must be kept hidden from their conservative father. Both young ladies are spirited, yet respectful.

Their lives are forever altered when Guida runs off to Greece with her sailor lover. As is too often the case with young dreamers, she returns home once her spontaneous choices prove to be poor judgment. Her father rejects his pregnant daughter since, in his eyes, she has disgraced the family. The parents mislead Guida about her sister's whereabouts, so Guida assumes Euridice is off at conservatory fulfilling her dreams. This sets Guida off on her own solitary path.

In actuality, Euridice has married and experienced one of the worst ever wedding nights, featuring what is likely cinema's most unsexy bathroom lovemaking scene. There is an element of horror films to this segment of the film, as the sisters are living their worst nightmares, while being separated from each other ... unable to communicate. The male-dominated Latin culture and family traditions prevent their mother from 'disobeying' the father's order, so the cruel lie continues as the sisters unknowingly live their lives within the same town. There is even one excruciatingly painful-to-watch scene that finds them in the same restaurant at the same time, yet oblivious to the presence of the other.

Each woman's inner-strength pushes them forward. Guida (now Gisele) befriends a wise former prostitute Filomena (an excellent Barbara Santos) who becomes her mentor in poverty. Euridice tries to make the best of her situation while keeping her dream alive. Mostly what we have is a tragic story without one specific tragedy - other than the daughter spurned by her father. There are so many moments of pain and frustration, with undelivered mail being among the worst. The film is beautifully shot by cinematographer Helene Louvart, and it reminds us that 'life happens', and it's not all love and Bach. This is an emotional and heart-breaking story, and devotees of The Lifetime Channel will likely be disappointed in the ending. For me, I have no qualms about the emotional wringer the film puts viewers through - even after the opening scene foreshadowing.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6797,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"duration":"PT2H19M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Place Beyond the Pines
Drugie oblicze
The Place Beyond the Pines
programme.desc:
The Place Beyond the Pines: Directed by Derek Cianfrance. With Ryan Gosling, Craig Van Hook, Eva Mendes, Olga Merediz. A motorcycle stunt rider turns to robbing banks as a way to provide for his lover and their newborn child, a decision that puts him on a collision course with an ambitious rookie cop navigating a department ruled by a corrupt detective." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1817273/","name":"The Place Beyond the Pines","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc1OTEwNjU4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzUzNDIwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331516/","name":"Ryan Gosling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177896/","name":"Bradley Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578949/","name":"Eva Mendes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161834/","name":"Derek Cianfrance"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0366362/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212525/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161834/","name":"Derek Cianfrance"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1397579/","name":"Ben Coccio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2942187/","name":"Darius Marder"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi267494937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyMzkwNzU0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODczNzAzOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyMzkwNzU0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODczNzAzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A motorcycle stunt rider turns to robbing banks as a way to provide for his lover and their newborn child, a decision that puts him on a collision course with an ambitious rookie cop navigating a department ruled by a corrupt detective. "},"datePublished":"2013-04-19","description":"A motorcycle stunt rider turns to robbing banks as a way to provide for his lover and their newborn child, a decision that puts him on a collision course with an ambitious rookie cop navigating a department ruled by a corrupt detecti","keywords":"bank robbery,neo noir,original story,bank,high school student","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1817273/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chrismartin181-1"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Starts great but loses steam","reviewBody":"The trailer to this film is rather misleading. It's the equivalent of advertising the whole of Disneyland with just clips of Space Mountain again and again. There's a lot more going on here than Ryan Gosling robbing banks and being a general badass in The Place Beyond The Pines. There are in fact at least three main characters all with their own story. And while the Ryan Gosling section is, a bit like Space Mountain at Disney, the best bit of the package he is only one part of a much bigger picture. 

A motor bike stunt rider finds out he has a son so packs in his day job and takes the logical step of robbing banks to provide for him. The story deals with the family life of the man as well as a rookie cop who exposes his police department to be corrupt. 

I found the film very absorbing from the start with Ryan Gosling's character development on fast forward so at least 3 massive life events all happen in the first 20 minutes of the film. There's not a lot of action scenes but when there are they're very tense and exciting. 

The family life aspect is quite heartwarming and you do believe that his character does love his son and wants to provide for him. There are fantastic believable acting performances all round here with Ryan Gosling and later on Bradley Cooper really showcasing their acting talents. It's engaging and I really cared what happened to both of their characters. 

The main problem with the film is it's length and not knowing when to stop. The first part of the film is constantly engaging and would be a nine out of ten if the film stayed like that the whole way through. When the focus shifts from characters however it really doesn't feel as exciting and almost feels like the start of totally different movie. A movie that isn't bad but is nowhere near as good as the one you've just seen.

Every story told is linked obviously but sometimes it feels a tad loose. There is a dramatic time shift when the film reaches the 100 minute mark and what follows really seems to drag. It never really felt like it was going anywhere. It was by no means boring however, it just lost a bit of steam towards the end. The Place Beyond The Pines is worth a watch but just be prepared to have you're socks blown off and then have them planted firmly back on your feet as the film continues.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":252565,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"duration":"PT2H20M"}</script><metacontent="

A band of soldiers must battle their way through Nazi territory to rescue a scientist that could help turn the tide of WWII." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6836772/","name":"Operation Dunkirk","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUxMDZjYTgtM2Q0MS00ZTRiLThkYzktNDQ3ZGMzMjY0ZjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM3MDMyMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A band of soldiers must battle their way through Nazi territory to rescue a scientist that could help turn the tide of WWII.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6836772/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Emma-M-V"},"dateCreated":"2017-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Asylum movie","reviewBody":"Asylum movies like this one only exist to piggyback off the popularity of more popular movies and trick gift-givers into buying the wrong movie come Christmas. They take a big-budget movie, such as Christopher Nolan's "Dunkirk", which they know is coming out soon and churn out a movie with a kind of similar plot and a very similar name, but with horrible acting, atrocious writing etc. for near no money at all. Charlie Price, a former scientist turned science fiction author, starts living one of his novels when the Federal Science Foundation's weather experiments escape control and turn disastrous." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1334456/","name":"Ice Twisters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzA2ZmEwNWYtNzllMy00NmE1LWFjOTctNGZmZjc4NTVhYWNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjcxNjI4NTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Charlie Price, a former scientist turned science fiction author, starts living one of his novels when the Federal Science Foundation's weather experiments escape control and turn disastrous.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1334456/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"XpocalypseSurvival"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good effort for a made for TV movie","reviewBody":"For a made for TV movie, this was pretty good. It is a pretty standard disaster story. It makes sense (if you just accept that the science is correct). Tends to be a bit cliche and predictable. The effects aren't great, but work well enough. Many reviews complain about the acting, but I thought they did a pretty good job. Yes, there are muted reactions that you get when you tell actors to pretend a bunch of ice tornadoes are about to kill you, but that is to be expected. Overall, a solid middle of the road film for me.\n\nSurvival lesson: hugging is good for your health, and for surviving ice tornadoes.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1718,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-11-14","keywords":"disaster movie,disaster film,science fiction author,wifi,weather control","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608601/","name":"Mark Moses"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0837992/","name":"Camille Sullivan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0259264/","name":"Kaj-Erik Eriksen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003458/","name":"Steven R. Monroe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054536/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0408885/","name":"Raul Inglis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1878140/","name":"Rafael Jordan"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Curse of the Dragon","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4222331673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Curse of the Dragon"},"datePublished":"2011-09-10","description":"A brave knight returns to his homeland to find a powerful dragon terrorizing his village. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick.","keywords":"sword and sorcery,monster","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1734203/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"w-n-strauss"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"I didn't care for it not one bit... however..","reviewBody":"Tim-764-291856: The monk, Lewis Carroll's poem "Jabberwocky" does not say the word "Jabberwocky" anywhere in the poem. The young man is warned by his elder to: " "Beware the Jabberwock, my son! The jaws that bite, the claws that catch! Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun The frumious Bandersnatch!"

Carroll was only making a silly, meaningless poem, most likely to amuse his young friend,( whom "Alice Through the Looking Glass" was based upon) thus, the title "Jabberwocky" which has no meaning.

Based solely on your review Tim, I chased this movie down and watched it. Now I wish I could unsee what I saw. I always loved Jabberwocky, it being one of my favorite poems of all time. It is now somewhat ruined by this very lame attempt to create a Jabberwock and slay it on film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":605,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Philadelphia Experiment
Eksperyment "Filadelfia"
The Philadelphia Experiment
programme.desc:
The Philadelphia Experiment: Directed by Paul Ziller. With Nicholas Lea, Michael Paré, Ryan Robbins, Emilie Ullerup. In 1943 a secret government cloaking project goes awry vanishing a navy destroyer. In 2012, the destroyer reappears, setting off a series of events threatening to destroy the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2039399/","name":"The Philadelphia Experiment","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU2YzZhNDYtZjk2Ny00MTljLWE5Y2ItM2JlMDJmY2QyMzAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzExMDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1943 a secret government cloaking project goes awry vanishing a navy destroyer. In 2012, the destroyer reappears, setting off a series of events threatening to destroy the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2039399/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gavin6942"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another SyFy Attempt From Paul Ziller","reviewBody":"A group of scientists trying to create a cloaking device accidentally conjure up the USS Eldridge, a ship that disappeared in 1943. Now their only priority is to send it back.

While I did not see the 1980s version of this story, I am familiar with what allegedly happened in real life. I think this is a fine plot of what could have happened, even if it does not necessarily make logical sense.

Director Paul Ziller is SyFy's go-to guy and has made quite a few of their productions now, with varying degrees of success. I feel like Ziller really has a handle on how to make a low-budget science fiction film, as he has the formula down. The weakest part is always the special effects (the computer-generated effects), which are out of his control.

Of course, this film also suffers from having Emilie Ullerup, one of the worst actresses in the history of the universe. Her character is a bit hard to believe (a world-class hacker working as a waitress in a small town diner), but even if we accept that, Ullerup just kept overacting repeatedly. I felt no sympathy for her and think the film would have been much better if her scenes were just cut out completely.

And why did the police officer wear jeans?","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2751,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-07-28","keywords":"plane crash,de 173 uss eldridge,business jet,1923 five dollar silver certificate,coffee shop","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494774/","name":"Nicholas Lea"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001595/","name":"Michael Paré"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730455/","name":"Ryan Robbins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0956484/","name":"Paul Ziller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263130/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0362708/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1337887/","name":"Andy Briggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2579139/","name":"David Sanderson"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Harvest
Krwawe żniwo
The Harvest
programme.desc:
The Harvest: Directed by David Marconi. With Miguel Ferrer, Leilani Sarelle, Henry Silva, Tony Denison. A screenwriter is sent to Mexico to develop a story that can be used to wrap up a movie presently in production. Given a very short time allotment, the writer immerses himself in the seamier side of a Mexican beach resort, but soon finds himself involved in a 'body organ for profit' operation. Drugged, he has one of his own kidneys removed, and then, with a woman he isn't sure he can trust, he sets out to expose the ring... with quite a surprise ending for the viewer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107084/","name":"The Harvest","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYyZDBiM2ItZjYxMS00MmE5LWE2MTEtN2VmNDRkMzkzZWJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001208/","name":"Miguel Ferrer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0765048/","name":"Leilani Sarelle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798328/","name":"Henry Silva"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070272/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039851/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Harvest (1993)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4253876505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYzIzYjYtNjU3YS00NjRhLWI1ZDktMGM2NDNiNGQzMTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYzIzYjYtNjU3YS00NjRhLWI1ZDktMGM2NDNiNGQzMTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"1993-11-05","description":"A screenwriter is sent to Mexico to develop a story that can be used to wrap up a movie presently in production. Given a very short time allotment, the writer immerses himself in the seamier side of a Mexican beach resort, but soon f","keywords":"knocked unconscious,male frontal nudity,male nudity,male pubic hair,based on urban legend","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andyroark"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quality proud B movie from the early 90s","reviewBody":"In this excellent unabashed B movie from 1993 you get to watch Miguel Ferrier and his wife turn one of the most enduring urban legends ever (guy wakes up in a bathtub of ice missing -insert body part- with instructions to call an ambulance) into a South of the Border escape covering topics from the Hollywood screen writing culture to Latin American police corruption to long term depression to child molestation to the underground gay community back to the Hollywood screen writing culture. What it lacks in production values (not much) it makes up for in heart.

This type of film was often showed on the off-brand pay movie channels in the early to mid 90s but usually centered more around the exposure of many, many nude body parts belonging to Shannon Tweed, Joan Severence or C. Thomas Howell (::shudder::). This film keeps its clothes on (and puts a dress on George Clooney, to boot) and delivers an enjoyable watching experience of pure escapist fantasy throughout which you will consistently thank God you aren't Miguel's character (when he is rolling around on the ground in pain) or curse God you aren't Miguel's character (when he is rolling around in the front seat of a Volkswagon with his insanely beautiful real life wife).

Good stuff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":605,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: In Her Skin
W jej skórze
In Her Skin
programme.desc:
In Her Skin: Directed by Simone North. With Guy Pearce, Miranda Otto, Ruth Bradley, Sam Neill. This is what every parent fears: their child not coming home when they're meant to. When the fifteen-year-old student, Rachel Barber, doesn't climb off the tram to meet her dad, Elizabeth, her mother, and Mike, her dad, bolt into action." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0995851/","name":"In Her Skin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM3NzIwMDQ3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTgyMzA2Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001602/","name":"Guy Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001584/","name":"Miranda Otto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1094112/","name":"Ruth Bradley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0636066/","name":"Simone North"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212146/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0636066/","name":"Simone North"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Her Skin","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1286642969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNzU5NDAxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI4NDA2NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNzU5NDAxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI4NDA2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Consumed with self-loathing, nineteen-year-old Caroline covets, stalks, abducts then murders fifteen-year-old Rachel Barber whom she considers "perfect"; everything she is not: beautiful, self-assured, happy. Despite police indifference, Rachel's family mounts a very public campaign to find her. "},"description":"This is what every parent fears: their child not coming home when they're meant to. When the fifteen-year-old student, Rachel Barber, doesn't climb off the tram to meet her dad, Elizabeth, her mother, and Mike, her dad, bolt into act","keywords":"missing person,fat girl,obsession,woman murders a woman,young murderer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0995851/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cwilsonservando"},"dateCreated":"2011-07-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fantastic, dark, compelling film with top notch performances","reviewBody":"I absolutely loved this film. I was totally gripped start to finish.

The mix of surreal camera work and character chapters made the horrific subject matter all then more intense and difficult to deal with, as it should be. The story itself suited the surreal elements that reflected the characters states of mind. All of these mixed elements create a bizarre world inside a real one, which enables the viewer to, to some extent, empathize and imagine the kind of horrors that the people these characters are based on must gone through.

Ruth Bradley, who plays Caroline is absolutely astonishing. She switches between creating terror or sympathy and is nothing short of completely convincing."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4753,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

for Metal Shifters"},"datePublished":"2011-03-11","description":"Alien bacteria arrives on a meteorite and infects metal, animating a giant iron statue that goes on a killing rampage in a small town.","keywords":"psychotronic film,alien,bar,dousing fire,fire","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1651894/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2011-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not so bad coming from SyFy, but not particularly good either","reviewBody":"A vast majority of the time, I intensely dislike SyFy's output, but there have also been some surprisingly tolerable if not great projects. Fortunately for Iron Invader, it falls into the latter category. The acting while not great is decent, likewise with the special effects with the Golem creature actually quite good, and the film with a somewhat intriguing concept starts off quite well. Sadly, the film loses it at the halfway mark, with the camera work becoming increasingly dizzying, the limited production values becoming more obvious and the pace becoming sluggish. While intriguing and starting off fine, the story is too thin to sustain the running time, the characters are rather shallow and the script is laughable in places. In conclusion, not good, not awful, just alright. 4/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1121,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

Sword of Xanten"},"datePublished":"2005-12-23","description":"The legend of Siegfried and Brunhild, loosely based on characters from the Norse sagas and the pre-Christian Germanic heroic motifs outlined in the Nibelungensaga.","keywords":"dragon,queen,king,blacksmith,treasure","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0387541/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paristeri"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"I wish they kept the original TITLE!","reviewBody":"It was by accident that I happened upon this movie on the sci/fi channel and realized what the story was really about- I enjoyed it very much and purchased the DVD after seeing it. I do wish the DVD was the original, however instead of the edited version. I am a major supporter of the new Beowulf and Grendel film by Sturla Gunnarson and think it's of interest that Nordic tales are making a comeback. We are definitely in need of some heroic myths that demonstrate the dichotomy/conflict inherent in these stories- That the human experience is not black versus white extremes- but all the colors in between..Finally I actually get the basic story of Siegfried and the ring of the Nieblungs..and I want to find out the rest of the story!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9346,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT3H4M"}</script><metacontent="

A comic book comes to life in a series of vignettes, exploring terrors ranging from murder, creatures, monsters, and delusions to the supernatural and unexplainable. You never know what will be on the next page..."},"datePublished":"2019-09-26","description":"The fictional Creepshow comic books come to life in this anthology series of terrifying tales hosted by the silent Creepshow ghoul.","keywords":"monster,reboot,ghoul,horror anthology,horror comic","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8762206/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BoringJoe"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"I'm a kid again","reviewBody":"When the original Creepshow movie came out I was just a child. Sure it was cheesy horror, but the stories were original and the comic book imagery helped bring out its creative appeal. These same sequences are still present in this new show. Will the stories be edgy, horror induced productions? Probably not, but when was the last time you saw a show or movie billed as a horror or scary movie that actually scared you? At least Creepshow doesn't regurgitate the same scary stories over and over. They actually flex their creative muscles and keep you entertained.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0083767, Title: Creepshow, --- Description: Creepshow: Directed by George A. Romero. With Hal Holbrook, Adrienne Barbeau, Fritz Weaver, Leslie Nielsen. An anthology which tells five terrifying tales inspired by the E.C. horror comic books of the 1950s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0083767/","name":"Creepshow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3NGIyZTctOWEyMS00MGIyLWFkZWMtMTg0ODE2MjExNGZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Horror"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001358/","name":"Hal Holbrook","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000558/","name":"Leslie Nielsen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000105/","name":"Adrienne Barbeau"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001681/","name":"George A. Romero"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163936/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099640/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099639/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000175/","name":"Stephen King"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1937948953","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM3YmRkMzctZmRkYS00OWFiLWE0OWUtNDhkYTFhMzlmNzg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM3YmRkMzctZmRkYS00OWFiLWE0OWUtNDhkYTFhMzlmNzg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An anthology which tells five terrifying tales inspired by the E.C. horror comic books of the 1950s.","datePublished":"1982-11-12","description":"An anthology which tells five terrifying tales inspired by the E.C. horror comic books of the 1950s.","keywords":"anthology,dark comedy,death,meteorite,child abuse","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0083767/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jezfernandez","dateCreated":"2016-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lovingly crafted B movie","reviewBody":"When I was about 13 years-old, I tried to rent this on VHS several times. Unfortunately, my mother kept walking in during a particularly violent segment and made me turn it off. It was a long time before I finally saw the whole film.

If you watch the accompanying Just Desserts documentary on the double-disc DVD, you'll see how lovingly crafted this film really was. Not only so, but this truly transcends the schlock horror of its E.C. origins. The acting is first rate and the plots surprisingly thoughtful, considering how short each segment is. For example, watch Aunt Bedelia's tortured graveside monologue in Father's Day, or the curious interplay between Henry and Dex in The Crate. E.G. Marshall totally nails it in They're Creeping Up On You, the segment most loaded with subtext.

Tom Savini's make-up effects are excellent and he doesn't scrimp on the gore. The one segment I dislike is Something To Tide You Over, as it's a particularly nasty and sadistic story (despite the just desserts moral).

Overall, this has a worthy place in the annals of 80s horror and will always hold fond memories for me; a young boy who just wanted to see that crate monster tear his victims apart like sour bread.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":43897,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"duration":"PT2H"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nightbreed
Nocne plemię
Nightbreed
programme.desc: Nightbreed: Directed by Clive Barker. With Craig Sheffer, Anne Bobby, David Cronenberg, Charles Haid. A troubled young man is drawn to a mythical place called Midian where a variety of friendly monsters are hiding from humanity. Meanwhile, a sadistic serial killer is looking for a patsy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100260/","name":"Nightbreed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmFlMWFiM2ItNWQ1Yy00ZDE2LWEzNmUtOTE0MDM4YjVjNmYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Fantasy","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001729/","name":"Craig Sheffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000343/","name":"David Cronenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0090321/","name":"Anne Bobby"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000850/","name":"Clive Barker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045933/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000850/","name":"Clive Barker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nightbreed","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2274951449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZmUxNzgtMTYwMS00M2RmLWJhMGItOGI1NDhhNzhiYzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZmUxNzgtMTYwMS00M2RmLWJhMGItOGI1NDhhNzhiYzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Extra (Clip) from 20th Century Fox"},"datePublished":"1990-02-16","description":"A troubled young man is drawn to a mythical place called Midian where a variety of friendly monsters are hiding from humanity. Meanwhile, a sadistic serial killer is looking for a patsy.","keywords":"mad doctor,motel,surrealism,supernatural power,surprise ending","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100260/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lime-3"},"dateCreated":"1999-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"A self-indulgent film, with potential.","reviewBody":"Clive Barker is, by far, the best horror writer of this century, and a fine visual artist as well. Few of the films made from his fiction are satisfactory "Clive Barker Experiences". This is partly because his main strength as a writer is, naturally, his use of language to provoke emotional reactions and to evoke very special moods above (beneath?) and beyond ordinary shock and revulsion. He raises horrific imagery and psychological situations to the level of poetry. This is not easy to do in film, a purely visual medium. The image of a monster or a monstrous act in film is a picture: there it is before you. A description of same in fiction can be given all sorts of depths and angles in the mind in writing. "Nightbreed" almost works as an adaptation of Barker's "Cabal". Unfortunately, as is apparent, most of Barker's budget was blown on the monsters (which are excellent movie monsters), with insufficient funds remaining for factors like cast. The actor who played the all-important role of Boone was not up to it at all. He conveyed almost nothing of the depth of Boone's torment, which exists on a number of levels. A talent should have been sought instead of a hunk. This is symptomatic of the film's weakness in general. Too many (albeit high-quality) monsters and too little time and attention spent on the basic human values (simply, character) which must underlie all fiction, no matter what its genre."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20554,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

Meanwhile, a sadistic serial killer is looking for a patsy.","keywords":"mad doctor,motel,surrealism,supernatural power,surprise ending","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100260/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"lime-3","dateCreated":"1999-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"A self-indulgent film, with potential.","reviewBody":"Clive Barker is, by far, the best horror writer of this century, and a fine visual artist as well. Few of the films made from his fiction are satisfactory "Clive Barker Experiences". This is partly because his main strength as a writer is, naturally, his use of language to provoke emotional reactions and to evoke very special moods above (beneath?) and beyond ordinary shock and revulsion. He raises horrific imagery and psychological situations to the level of poetry. This is not easy to do in film, a purely visual medium. The image of a monster or a monstrous act in film is a picture: there it is before you. A description of same in fiction can be given all sorts of depths and angles in the mind in writing. "Nightbreed" almost works as an adaptation of Barker's "Cabal". Unfortunately, as is apparent, most of Barker's budget was blown on the monsters (which are excellent movie monsters), with insufficient funds remaining for factors like cast. The actor who played the all-important role of Boone was not up to it at all. He conveyed almost nothing of the depth of Boone's torment, which exists on a number of levels. A talent should have been sought instead of a hunk. This is symptomatic of the film's weakness in general. Too many (albeit high-quality) monsters and too little time and attention spent on the basic human values (simply, character) which must underlie all fiction, no matter what its genre.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20554,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stranger Than Fiction
Przypadek Harolda Cricka
Stranger Than Fiction
programme.desc:
Stranger Than Fiction: Directed by Marc Forster. With Will Ferrell, William Dick, Guy Massey, Martha Espinoza. I.R.S. auditor Harold Crick suddenly finds himself the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire life, from his work, to his love-interest, to his death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0420223/","name":"Stranger Than Helm"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stranger Than Fiction","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2710241561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRlZDQ1MjQtMjIwOS00YTE5LTg3MjQtNDU4ZTg1ZmI4MjA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRlZDQ1MjQtMjIwOS00YTE5LTg3MjQtNDU4ZTg1ZmI4MjA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2006-11-10","description":"I.R.S. auditor Harold Crick suddenly finds himself the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire life, from his work, to his love-interest, to his death.","keywords":"author,fate,professor,novelist,writer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0420223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"imagineer99"},"dateCreated":"2006-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Strangely Addicting","reviewBody":"With his unassuming eyes and sheepish, "awe shucks!" demeanor, Will Ferrell is quite simply the guy you root forthe eternal boy trapped in a gangly 6'3" frame. Just a single look can make you giggle and smile so effortlessly that you're often unaware that you're actually doing it. It is with this notion that Stranger than FictionFerrell's first major foray into a theatrical world outside the realm of in-your-face frat boy sillinessjust makes sense. By surrounding Ferrell's charisma with a subdued, darkly comic script and a talented supporting cast, we get a film that is both fresh and heartfelt. 

Directed by Marc Forster and penned by Zach Helm, Stranger than Fiction is an odd mix-mash, combining a standard comedy with existentialist ideas. Number crunching IRS agent and genuine loser, Harold Crick (Ferrell) one day wakes up to find his life being narrated word for word by burnt out writer Karen Eiffel (Emma Thompson). Odd thing is, Eiffel is writing an actual book where Crick just happens to be the main character. To make matters worse, she plans on killing him off as soon as she can make it through a particularly arduous stretch of writer's block.

Originality is one thing that is absent from a majority of contemporary Hollywood pictures, so Fiction immediately gets points for simply trying something different. I suppose it's icing on the cake that the film is genuinely good. Crick, knowing that is death is imminent, begins to break out of his cloistered shell and to experience the fruits of his life. And, in the process he forms a bond with a tax breaking baker (Gyllenhal) and seeks advice from a literature professor, played by a particularly charming Dustin Hoffman 

However, even though it is well intentioned, the execution isn't flawless. The romance that develops between Gyllenhal's outcast baker and Ferrell's strait-laced Crick doesn't feel entirely organic. We admire the relationship and smile at its sugar coated sweetness, but we don't necessarily believe their connection. It may taste good, but it doesn't exactly wash down smoothly. Neither, does the film's over reliance on reinforcing generic, "Carpe Diem" philosophies. Towards the second act, things do get sappy. Luckily, by the conclusion, the plot has bounced back to a wonderful limbo of both oddly comic and genuinely heartwarming moments.

For all its flaws, Stranger than Fiction, works. Like a good novel, Forster has fashioned something that is strange, stylistic, and unexpectedly inspiring. And, despite the chinks in its existentialist armor, that's surely something worth writing home about.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":222599,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick.","keywords":"sword and sorcery,monster","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1734203/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"w-n-strauss"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"I didn't care for it not one bit... however..","reviewBody":"Tim-764-291856: The monk, Lewis Carroll's poem "Jabberwocky" does not say the word "Jabberwocky" anywhere in the poem. The young man is warned by his elder to: " "Beware the Jabberwock, my son! The jaws that bite, the claws that catch! Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun The frumious Bandersnatch!"

Carroll was only making a silly, meaningless poem, most likely to amuse his young friend,( whom "Alice Through the Looking Glass" was based upon) thus, the title "Jabberwocky" which has no meaning.

Based solely on your review Tim, I chased this movie down and watched it. Now I wish I could unsee what I saw. I always loved Jabberwocky, it being one of my favorite poems of all time. It is now somewhat ruined by this very lame attempt to create a Jabberwock and slay it on film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":605,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Harvest
Krwawe żniwo
The Harvest
programme.desc:
The Harvest: Directed by David Marconi. With Miguel Ferrer, Leilani Sarelle, Henry Silva, Tony Denison. A screenwriter is sent to Mexico to develop a story that can be used to wrap up a movie presently in production. Given a very short time allotment, the writer immerses himself in the seamier side of a Mexican beach resort, but soon finds himself involved in a 'body organ for profit' operation. Drugged, he has one of his own kidneys removed, and then, with a woman he isn't sure he can trust, he sets out to expose the ring... with quite a surprise ending for the viewer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107084/","name":"The Harvest","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYyZDBiM2ItZjYxMS00MmE5LWE2MTEtN2VmNDRkMzkzZWJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001208/","name":"Miguel Ferrer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0765048/","name":"Leilani Sarelle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798328/","name":"Henry Silva"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070272/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039851/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545861/","name":"David Marconi"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Harvest (1993)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4253876505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYzIzYjYtNjU3YS00NjRhLWI1ZDktMGM2NDNiNGQzMTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYzIzYjYtNjU3YS00NjRhLWI1ZDktMGM2NDNiNGQzMTlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"1993-11-05","description":"A screenwriter is sent to Mexico to develop a story that can be used to wrap up a movie presently in production. Given a very short time allotment, the writer immerses himself in the seamier side of a Mexican beach resort, but soon f","keywords":"knocked unconscious,male frontal nudity,male nudity,male pubic hair,based on urban legend","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andyroark"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quality proud B movie from the early 90s","reviewBody":"In this excellent unabashed B movie from 1993 you get to watch Miguel Ferrier and his wife turn one of the most enduring urban legends ever (guy wakes up in a bathtub of ice missing -insert body part- with instructions to call an ambulance) into a South of the Border escape covering topics from the Hollywood screen writing culture to Latin American police corruption to long term depression to child molestation to the underground gay community back to the Hollywood screen writing culture. What it lacks in production values (not much) it makes up for in heart.

This type of film was often showed on the off-brand pay movie channels in the early to mid 90s but usually centered more around the exposure of many, many nude body parts belonging to Shannon Tweed, Joan Severence or C. Thomas Howell (::shudder::). This film keeps its clothes on (and puts a dress on George Clooney, to boot) and delivers an enjoyable watching experience of pure escapist fantasy throughout which you will consistently thank God you aren't Miguel's character (when he is rolling around on the ground in pain) or curse God you aren't Miguel's character (when he is rolling around in the front seat of a Volkswagon with his insanely beautiful real life wife).

Good stuff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":605,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: In Her Skin
W jej skórze
In Her Skin
programme.desc:
In Her Skin: Directed by Simone North. With Guy Pearce, Miranda Otto, Ruth Bradley, Sam Neill. This is what every parent fears: their child not coming home when they're meant to. When the fifteen-year-old student, Rachel Barber, doesn't climb off the tram to meet her dad, Elizabeth, her mother, and Mike, her dad, bolt into action." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0995851/","name":"In Her Skin","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM3NzIwMDQ3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTgyMzA2Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001602/","name":"Guy Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001584/","name":"Miranda Otto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1094112/","name":"Ruth Bradley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0636066/","name":"Simone North"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212146/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0636066/","name":"Simone North"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Her Skin","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1286642969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNzU5NDAxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI4NDA2NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNzU5NDAxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI4NDA2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Consumed with self-loathing, nineteen-year-old Caroline covets, stalks, abducts then murders fifteen-year-old Rachel Barber whom she considers "perfect"; everything she is not: beautiful, self-assured, happy. Despite police indifference, Rachel's family mounts a very public campaign to find her. "},"description":"This is what every parent fears: their child not coming home when they're meant to. When the fifteen-year-old student, Rachel Barber, doesn't climb off the tram to meet her dad, Elizabeth, her mother, and Mike, her dad, bolt into act","keywords":"missing person,fat girl,obsession,woman murders a woman,young murderer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0995851/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cwilsonservando"},"dateCreated":"2011-07-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fantastic, dark, compelling film with top notch performances","reviewBody":"I absolutely loved this film. I was totally gripped start to finish.

The mix of surreal camera work and character chapters made the horrific subject matter all then more intense and difficult to deal with, as it should be. The story itself suited the surreal elements that reflected the characters states of mind. All of these mixed elements create a bizarre world inside a real one, which enables the viewer to, to some extent, empathize and imagine the kind of horrors that the people these characters are based on must gone through.

Ruth Bradley, who plays Caroline is absolutely astonishing. She switches between creating terror or sympathy and is nothing short of completely convincing."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4753,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

fire,fire","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1651894/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2011-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not so bad coming from SyFy, but not particularly good either","reviewBody":"A vast majority of the time, I intensely dislike SyFy's output, but there have also been some surprisingly tolerable if not great projects. Fortunately for Iron Invader, it falls into the latter category. The acting while not great is decent, likewise with the special effects with the Golem creature actually quite good, and the film with a somewhat intriguing concept starts off quite well. Sadly, the film loses it at the halfway mark, with the camera work becoming increasingly dizzying, the limited production values becoming more obvious and the pace becoming sluggish. While intriguing and starting off fine, the story is too thin to sustain the running time, the characters are rather shallow and the script is laughable in places. In conclusion, not good, not awful, just alright. 4/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1121,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

Sword of Xanten"},"datePublished":"2005-12-23","description":"The legend of Siegfried and Brunhild, loosely based on characters from the Norse sagas and the pre-Christian Germanic heroic motifs outlined in the Nibelungensaga.","keywords":"dragon,queen,king,blacksmith,treasure","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0387541/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paristeri"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"I wish they kept the original TITLE!","reviewBody":"It was by accident that I happened upon this movie on the sci/fi channel and realized what the story was really about- I enjoyed it very much and purchased the DVD after seeing it. I do wish the DVD was the original, however instead of the edited version. I am a major supporter of the new Beowulf and Grendel film by Sturla Gunnarson and think it's of interest that Nordic tales are making a comeback. We are definitely in need of some heroic myths that demonstrate the dichotomy/conflict inherent in these stories- That the human experience is not black versus white extremes- but all the colors in between..Finally I actually get the basic story of Siegfried and the ring of the Nieblungs..and I want to find out the rest of the story!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9346,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT3H4M"}</script><metacontent="

group of thieves breaks into a chamber expecting to find paintings, but instead they release the count himself, who travels to New Orleans to find his nemesis' daughter, Mary Van Helsing.","keywords":"van helsing,lucy westenra character,van helsing character,dr jack seward character,first part","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0219653/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hokeybutt"},"dateCreated":"2005-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Uh, Wes Craven Did *What* On This Movie?","reviewBody":"Dracula 2000 (3 outta 5 stars) I didn't expect much from this movie... so I guess that's why I ended up enjoying it as much as I did. There are some interesting interpretations of the vampire myth as it relates to Christianity (not to give anything away)... explaining vampires' aversion to crosses and silver, among other things. The story is kind of all over the place... Dracula is resurrected in the year 2000 by a band of wayward thieves who mistakenly believe that the mysterious Dr. Van Helsing (Christopher Plummer) is hiding something really valuable in that hidden, underground vault. Van Helsing's estranged daughter is simultaneously having weird visions... her father has tried to keep her free from the family legacy for years... but you know IL' Dracula isn't going to let that go on. I could have done without a lot of the wise-ass one-liners from the heroic leading man (Jonny Lee Miller)... it tends to cheapen the whole story and dilute the tension. Still, the movie is a lot better than other recent vampire flicks. I was a bit suspicious of the "Wes Craven Presents" that they tacked onto the title in a desperate ploy to attract an audience... but I think the movie is actually a lot better than 80% of the movies that Craven actually *does* direct. (I'm not much of a fan as you can probably guess.) Good flick... I'm not too sure I want to rush out and see the straight-to-video sequels though."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32513,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="
