programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings
Truciciele z Salisbury
The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 10394886, Title: The Salisbury Poisonings, --- Description: The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray","dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray","dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. Keeping Faith
programme.desc: Keeping Faith: Created by Matthew Hall. With Eve Myles, Bradley Freegard, Mark Lewis Jones, Hannah Daniel. Faith, a small-town Welsh lawyer, is forced to cut short her extended maternity leave when her husband and business partner, Evan, goes missing. As the truth of his actions surface, Faith must fight to protect her family and her sanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6658720/","name":"Keeping Faith","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQzMDMyMzItMTg2MS00NmFiLThhZGMtNzhiZGIzNjE3NWE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQ5NTYyOTY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616990/","name":"Eve Myles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1164626/","name":"Bradley Freegard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428765/","name":"Mark Lewis Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0453072/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0595504/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0453072/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355888/","name":"Matthew Hall"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Keeping Faith: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2957948953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWZjYmQ3OGItZDEyMS00YzVkLWIwMzctODlmYWU0NWExMmZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWZjYmQ3OGItZDEyMS00YzVkLWIwMzctODlmYWU0NWExMmZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Series Trailer"},"datePublished":"2018-02-13","description":"Faith, a small-town Welsh lawyer, is forced to cut short her extended maternity leave when her husband and business partner, Evan, goes missing. As the truth of his actions surface, Faith must fight to protect her family and her sani","keywords":"fight","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6658720/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lineypeter-229-110733"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cymraeg Noir?","reviewBody":"I can't believe some of the reviews here. 'Too slow'? Really? Oh well, I guess it's all a matter of taste, but I would've thought everyone would welcome such originality. Personally, I wouldn't miss a minute of it. Great script, wonderfully acted, excellent direction - oh, and a special word for the cinematographer: also outstanding. As for Eve Myles: well, she has an advantage over every other actor I know as she seems to have twice as many expressions as they do. More than that, I love the way she takes risks; the times when she starts something that leaves you hanging for a split-second, wondering if she'll be able to see it through. But she does. Every time. For me, rather special, and I hope it's not the only series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4278,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:

programme.title: Maskineriet
Maskineriet
The Machinery
Maskineriet
programme.desc: Maskineriet: With Kristoffer Joner, Julia Schacht, Hanna Alström, Emilia Roosmann. Olle Hulten wakes up drunk on the ferry between Sandefjord and Strömstad. In his car is a gun and a lot of money. Simultaneously the police is chasing a robber whom have hijacked a car and is holding the security guard at gunpoint." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11806034/","name":"Maskineriet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2U4MGE5ZjItOTc0Ni00YTIyLThkMzktODUzYTA2MGNjNTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDIyMzc3Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Olle Hulten wakes up drunk on the ferry between Sandefjord and Strömstad. In his car is a gun and a lot of money. Simultaneously the police is chasing a robber whom have hijacked a car and is holding the security guard at gunpoint.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11806034/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sara_Tor"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ridiculously hilarious","reviewBody":"This isn't a 1 purely because it got so bad it became hilarious in a d movie kind of way. There are a lot of manhunts carried out by the world's worst cops, and more unlikely coincidences, bad shots, and obvious suspects than you can possibly imagine. The ending is like a satire of action movies.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":633,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-05-24","keywords":"criminality in sweden,sweden,gun,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427379/","name":"Kristoffer Joner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1863949/","name":"Julia Schacht"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0022609/","name":"Hanna Alström"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0575653/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0712319/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0488702/"}]}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Król: Prolog
programme.desc: O ośmioodcinkowym serialu "Król" porozmawiają jego twórcy - reżyser Jan P. Matuszyński, aktor Michał Żurawski oraz autor powieści będącej podstawą scenariusza, Szczepan Twardoch. Widzowie dowiedzą się m.in. kto jeszcze był brany pod uwagę do zagrania głównej roli i co było inspiracją dla pisarza przy tworzeniu książki. Twardoch opowie także o swoich wrażeniach z planu serialu, a reżyser zdradzi, jakie było największe wyzwanie podczas kręcenia zdjęć.

programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings
Truciciele z Salisbury
The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 10394886, Title: The Salisbury Poisonings, --- Description: The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray","dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. IMDb data; ttnr: 10394886, Title: The Salisbury Poisonings, --- Description: The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Judah Cousin, Annabel Scholey. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kris-gray","dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent stuff","reviewBody":"So to the one star reviewers, are you being paid to do them?

Let's start with ricpambon - well he has only submitted this one review, that should tell you something. He says that Dawn sprays the liquid on her wrist in the first episode, she doesn't, she may well spray something then but not from the Novichok bottle. The people involved were interviewed for the series and I would have though Charlie could have told them where he found the bottle so to say the BBC don't know is plainly ridiculous.

AnthonyVincentBruno - well is only contribution is a two line slag off of Marc Addy, did he steal your wife? No other constructive criticism, so why bother.

Smoochemail - well again the only review this person has submitted so I find that as suspect as the first one I mentioned. their erroneous comment that you don't recover from Novichok is laughable when four people quite obviously did!

pkeenor - again only this one review, how do you expect us to believe you?

dayeym - probably the only believable review, other reviews are mixed. Maybe it was too long for him but to say it's rubbish with no explanation other than it was too long isn't' right.

So to my opinion, well I used to live near Salisbury, moved abroad before this incident happened but still had family in the area when it did, still do. So i recognised a lot of the locations used, yes they did film in the city.

I thought all the cast were believable, yes even the fat bloke from the Tesco ads. When you saw the real people at the end you realised how well they were cast. As a previous reviewer stated Anne-Marie Duff was excellent and nice not to have a supermodel play the part, as the Yanks would have done. Rafe Spall well he is a chip off the old block isn't he! MyAnna Burning from Ripper Street, and more, proves what a versatile actor she is, born in Sweden, you wouldn't know it from the accent here. Then there is Annabel Scholey from The Split, I could go on, there wasn't a duff performance here,

The fact that the real protagonist are shown at the end proves they were all involved in the creation of this series. To say it was a misrepresentation of the facts is an insult those involved and particularly the family and memory of Dawn Sturgess, shame on you.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4197,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8982365/","name":"Judah Cousin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. As the truth of his actions surface, Faith must fight to protect her family and her sani","keywords":"fight","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6658720/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lineypeter-229-110733"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cymraeg Noir?","reviewBody":"I can't believe some of the reviews here. 'Too slow'? Really? Oh well, I guess it's all a matter of taste, but I would've thought everyone would welcome such originality. Personally, I wouldn't miss a minute of it. Great script, wonderfully acted, excellent direction - oh, and a special word for the cinematographer: also outstanding. As for Eve Myles: well, she has an advantage over every other actor I know as she seems to have twice as many expressions as they do. More than that, I love the way she takes risks; the times when she starts something that leaves you hanging for a split-second, wondering if she'll be able to see it through. But she does. Every time. For me, rather special, and I hope it's not the only series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4278,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1}}</script><metacontent="

60 kilo niczego
programme.desc: Krzysztof Kowalik (Grzegorz Damięcki) zaczyna nowy dzień pracy na stanowisku kierownika kopalni kruszców. Żeby zyskać posłuch, zamierza sprawować bezwzględne rządy. Kiedy dochodzi do nieszczęśliwego wypadku, jego moralność zostaje wystawiona na próbę.

programme.title: Remont w 48h 9
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski i jego ekipa udowadniają, że 48 godzin to wystarczająco dużo czasu, by solidnie wyremontować jedno pomieszczenie. Uczestnicy programu powierzają ekspertom swoje salony, sypialnie, kuchnie oraz łazienki. Wnętrza przejdą zadziwiające metamorfozy. Widzowie obserwują specjalistów przy pracy, poznając wiele przydatnych rozwiązań, rad i niedrogich pomysłów.

programme.title: Hotelowa Polska
programme.desc: Program pokazuje polskie hotele, które warto odwiedzić. Najdroższe nie zawsze jest najlepsze. Ta zasada sprawdza się też w kwestii noclegów. Prowadzący Damian Urbańczyk przybliża miejsca, które czarują gości niepowtarzalną atmosferą. Widzowie zwiedzają urocze pokoje, ekskluzywne restauracje oraz luksusowe salony spa, które gwarantują różne formy wypoczynku. Nie brakuje też oryginalnych pomysłów na podróże.

programme.title: This is speedway
programme.desc: Łukasz Benz rozmawia z największymi gwiazdami światowego żużla. O swojej przygodzie z czarnym sportem opowiedzą mu m.in. sześciokrotny mistrz świata Tony Rickardsson i dwukrotny mistrz świata juniorów Darcy Ward.

credits.actor: Maciej Orłowski

programme.title: Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Domowa piekarnia Kucharskiego
programme.desc: Piotr Kucharski pokazuje, jak przygotować klasyczne polskie wypieki. Podaje przepisy na chleby drożdżowe i na zakwasie oraz bułeczki na słodko i słono. Zdradza tajniki powstawanie bagietek, bajgli, cebularzy i precli. Nie zabraknie też specjałów z różnych stron świata - mistrz kuchni serwuje indyjskie chlebki naan, tureckie pity, gruzińskie chaczapuri i brioszki. Na deser proponuje chrupiące gofry.

programme.title: Ugotuj mi, mamo! 2
programme.desc: Iwona Zasuwa, autorka bloga Smakoterapia, zaskakuje pomysłowością dań dla dzieci. Gotuje w towarzystwie mam i ich pociech. Oprócz ciekawych pomysłów na potrawy przygotowywane z myślą o najmłodszych, gospodyni programu podzieli się także wieloma praktycznymi radami na temat tego co, jak i kiedy serwować swoim milusińskim. Ponadto eksperci wytłumaczą, dlaczego pewne produkty szkodzą, a inne mają zbawienny wpływ na zdrowie zarówno dzieci, jak i rodziców.

programme.title: David w Europie 3
programme.desc: David Gaboriaud wyrusza w kulinarną podróż po Europie. Odwiedza m.in. Kopenhagę, Wilno i Tallinn. Gotuje potrawy, inspirując się lokalnymi składnikami, i przybliża charakterystykę miejscowej kuchni.

programme.title: David w Europie 3
programme.desc: David Gaboriaud wyrusza w kulinarną podróż po Europie. Odwiedza m.in. Kopenhagę, Wilno i Tallinn. Gotuje potrawy, inspirując się lokalnymi składnikami, i przybliża charakterystykę miejscowej kuchni.

programme.title: Kupione i co dalej? 3
programme.desc: Projektantka Marta Czerkies urządza kolejne mieszkania i domy w stanie deweloperskim. Przeprowadza właścicieli nieruchomości przez cały proces - od projektu do efektu końcowego. Pomaga dostosować wizję wymarzonego wnętrza do możliwości finansowych. W programie znajdzie się też wiele praktycznych porad, inspiracji i remontowych trików.

programme.title: Acid Rain
programme.desc: Młoda ucieka z domu. Podróżuje autostopem. Poznaje niezrównoważonego dziwaka Chudego. Pod osłoną nocy snują się po mieście, docierają w coraz dziwniejsze rejony, doświadczając niezwykłych emocji.

programme.title: Remont w 48h 9
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski i jego ekipa udowadniają, że 48 godzin to wystarczająco dużo czasu, by solidnie wyremontować jedno pomieszczenie. Uczestnicy programu powierzają ekspertom swoje salony, sypialnie, kuchnie oraz łazienki. Wnętrza przejdą zadziwiające metamorfozy. Widzowie obserwują specjalistów przy pracy, poznając wiele przydatnych rozwiązań, rad i niedrogich pomysłów.

programme.title: Remont w 48h 9
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski i jego ekipa udowadniają, że 48 godzin to wystarczająco dużo czasu, by solidnie wyremontować jedno pomieszczenie. Uczestnicy programu powierzają ekspertom swoje salony, sypialnie, kuchnie oraz łazienki. Wnętrza przejdą zadziwiające metamorfozy. Widzowie obserwują specjalistów przy pracy, poznając wiele przydatnych rozwiązań, rad i niedrogich pomysłów.

programme.title: Remont w 48h 10
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski ponownie udowadnia, że remont pomieszczenia nie musi trwać w nieskończoność. Niekiedy wystarczą na niego jedynie dwie doby. Ekipa pokazuje, że koszty takiego przedsięwzięcia także można zredukować do minimum. Podczas prac, widzowie poznają pomysłowe rozwiązania oraz wskazówki, jak w prosty i tani sposób szybko odmienić wygląd swojego mieszkania.

programme.title: Hotelowa Polska
programme.desc: Program pokazuje polskie hotele, które warto odwiedzić. Najdroższe nie zawsze jest najlepsze. Ta zasada sprawdza się też w kwestii noclegów. Prowadzący Damian Urbańczyk przybliża miejsca, które czarują gości niepowtarzalną atmosferą. Widzowie zwiedzają urocze pokoje, ekskluzywne restauracje oraz luksusowe salony spa, które gwarantują różne formy wypoczynku. Nie brakuje też oryginalnych pomysłów na podróże.

programme.title: News+

programme.title: Festiwal Filmowy w Wenecji - relacja. Presented by Lexus
Tenis: Turniej WTA w Cincinnati - mecz ćwierćfinałowy gry pojedynczej: Belinda Bencić - Jil Belen Teichmann
programme.desc: Polska ukazana z niezwykłej perspektywy - z lotu ptaka. Tym razem twórcy starają się przede wszystkim uchwycić na swoich zdjęciach najróżniejsze królewskie zamki obronne, magnackie pałace oraz szlacheckie dwory i dworki. Nie zabraknie widoku takich miejsc jak Niedzica, Czorsztyn, Ujazd, Chęciny, Rabsztyn, Czersk czy Siewierz. Oprócz samych fotografii zostanie przedstawiona także porywająca historia losów właścicieli tych lokacji. Widzowie zobaczą także wnętrza opisywanych twierdz i dworów.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga francuska - Podsumowanie sezonu 2020/21
programme.desc: Polska ukazana z niezwykłej perspektywy - z lotu ptaka. Tym razem twórcy starają się przede wszystkim uchwycić na swoich zdjęciach najróżniejsze królewskie zamki obronne, magnackie pałace oraz szlacheckie dwory i dworki. Nie zabraknie widoku takich miejsc jak Niedzica, Czorsztyn, Ujazd, Chęciny, Rabsztyn, Czersk czy Siewierz. Oprócz samych fotografii zostanie przedstawiona także porywająca historia losów właścicieli tych lokacji. Widzowie zobaczą także wnętrza opisywanych twierdz i dworów.

Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Polska z góry. Zamki, dworki, pałace
Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Ugotuj mi, mamo! 2
programme.desc: Iwona Zasuwa, autorka bloga Smakoterapia, zaskakuje pomysłowością dań dla dzieci. Gotuje w towarzystwie mam i ich pociech. Oprócz ciekawych pomysłów na potrawy przygotowywane z myślą o najmłodszych, gospodyni programu podzieli się także wieloma praktycznymi radami na temat tego co, jak i kiedy serwować swoim milusińskim. Ponadto eksperci wytłumaczą, dlaczego pewne produkty szkodzą, a inne mają zbawienny wpływ na zdrowie zarówno dzieci, jak i rodziców.

programme.title: David w Europie 3
programme.desc: David Gaboriaud wyrusza w kulinarną podróż po Europie. Odwiedza m.in. Kopenhagę, Wilno i Tallinn. Gotuje potrawy, inspirując się lokalnymi składnikami, i przybliża charakterystykę miejscowej kuchni.

programme.title: Kupione i co dalej? 3
programme.desc: Projektantka Marta Czerkies urządza kolejne mieszkania i domy w stanie deweloperskim. Przeprowadza właścicieli nieruchomości przez cały proces - od projektu do efektu końcowego. Pomaga dostosować wizję wymarzonego wnętrza do możliwości finansowych. W programie znajdzie się też wiele praktycznych porad, inspiracji i remontowych trików.

programme.title: Kupione i co dalej? 3

programme.title: Remont w 48h 12

programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. programme.title: Wino truskawkowe
Wino truskawkowe
programme.desc: Wino truskawkowe: Directed by Dariusz Jablonski. With Jirí Machácek, Zuzana Fialová, Marian Dziedziel, Mieczyslaw Grabka. This is not a love story though it is full of love. It is not a comedy though the characters often say funny things. It is not a detective story even though the hero is trying to solve a murder. It is not a nature drama though it shows the splendid colours and customs of the countryside. It is not a musical though Lubica expresses her longing in a passionate dance. Nor is it a film about ghosts though a ghost does ask the hero for a favour. A few draughts of Strawberry Wine are enough to take us into a magical world in the true centre of Europe, where love, crime and penitence are just as much a part of life as the changing of the seasons, the migration of birds or the flowing of a mountain stream." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1260596/","name":"Wino truskawkowe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI5MjU4YjUtNGJkNy00Nzk2LTgyYWEtMDk0OTBmY2NmZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTgyNDg0NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is not a love story though it is full of love. programme.title: O co biega?
programme.desc: W magazynie nowinki oraz praktyczne porady dla osób, które uprawiają bieganie rekreacyjnie, półprofesjonalnie, zawodowo lub dopiero zaczynają. Gospodarz programu Marcin Rosłoń wraz z ekspertami będzie podpowiadał, jak przygotować się do biegania amatorskiego i zawodowego, jak dobrać odpowiedni sprzęt lub przygotować się do maratonu. W programie nie zabraknie również ciekawostek, rozmów ze sportowcami i osobami z show-biznesu, które opowiedzą o swojej pasji do biegania.

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
Mój kuzyn Vinny
My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc:
My Cousin Vinny: Directed by Jonathan Lynn. With Joe Pesci, Ralph Macchio, Marisa Tomei, Mitchell Whitfield. Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0104952/","name":"My Cousin Vinny","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNDYzMTg1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzk4MDgxMTE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000582/","name":"Joe Pesci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000673/","name":"Marisa Tomei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001494/","name":"Ralph Macchio"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528718/","name":"Jonathan Lynn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057987/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0731057/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0490958/","name":"Dale Launer"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Cousin Vinny","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2744844569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"datePublished":"1992-03-13","description":"Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.","keywords":"trial,pantyhose,lawyer,alabama,jail","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0104952/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mattymatt4ever"},"dateCreated":"2001-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brooklyn lawyer Pesci tries to save the "two yutes" from frying in the electric chair. Classic!","reviewBody":""My Cousin Vinny," along with the megahit "Goodfellas," put Pesci on the map. Of course, he's been in the Scorcese's previous hit "Raging Bull," but didn't get a hell of a lot of recognition at the time. Joe Pesci's character of Vincent LaGuardia Gambini is a landmark character in comedy history. When his New Yauker street smarts collide with Southern hospitality--brilliant fish-out-of-water humor ensues! 

 Of course, Pesci should've be given all the credit. Marisa Tomei, who RIGHTFULLY won the Supporting Oscar for her excellent performance (please don't believe that urban myth about Jack Palance calling out the wrong name!!), is hilarious as Pesci's fiance with a foul mouth, a smart a**, the heaviest Brooklyn accent and an incredible expertise in automobiles. This was also the movie that made Marisa a star, and a performance I commend to this day.

What can I say? This movie has some of the most priceless bits of comedy. One, of course, involves Pesci's pronunciation of the word "youth" which sounds like "yute." One underrated bit is the one where Pesci first meets his cousin's friend (Mitchell Whitfield) in the jail cell. His cousin (Ralph Macchio) is asleep and Pesci suddenly pays the friend a visit. He doesn't know Pesci is the lawyer, and assumes he's some guy who...wants to make him his b**ch. The comic dialogue in that scene is so perfectly executed and I feel it's one of the funniest in the movie. I'm not going to give away any more of the film's slick, intelligent humor--You have to see it for yourself!!!

If you're in the mood for a smart, well-written, well-acted comedy that will have you on the floor--look no further! "My Cousin Vinny" doesn't disappoint in any of those aspects. This is a truly memorable piece of comedy, and though it was released in 1992, I'm sure comedy lovers will pay homage to this movie in the present day.

My score: 8 (out of 10)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":111623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Seberg
programme.desc: Seberg: Directed by Benedict Andrews. With Kristen Stewart, Yvan Attal, Gabriel Sky, Jack O'Connell. Inspired by real events in the life of French New Wave icon Jean Seberg. In the late 1960s, Hoover's FBI targeted her because of her political and romantic involvement with civil rights activist Hakim Jamal." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1780967/","name":"Seberg","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjk5MTdhZGQtMDEzMC00NTk3LTg1ZjgtZTNhN2RlYzY3N2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODk4OTc3MTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Inspired by real events in the life of French New Wave icon Jean Seberg. In the late 1960s, Hoover's FBI targeted her because of her political and romantic involvement with civil rights activist Hakim Jamal.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1780967/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's worth a watch, but don't expect to be blown away...","reviewBody":"A rather creative tale of the actress Jean Seberg and of her association with the Black Panther movement in America that ends up with her under FBI surveillance. Kristen Stewart does make an effort; but this whole film is just too linear; the actress - if she really was anything like this portrayal in real life, was a selfish and thoughtless individual who appears to care little for her husband or son. As such it's quite hard to sympathise with her even though at a political level; "Seberg" does make you realise (a bit like "The Report") just how little practical oversight the US Congress actually appears to have over the operations of Federal Agencies. Jack O'Connell isn't very convincing at the BFI guy with a conscience either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7098,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-12-13","keywords":"film star,french author,radical politics,1960s,civil rights movement","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2044706585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWIxMjYzMjgtMGE5My00ODA2LWFiOGQtOGZjNWM0YzE0MmI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWIxMjYzMjgtMGE5My00ODA2LWFiOGQtOGZjNWM0YzE0MmI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Seberg is inspired by true events about the French New Wave darling and Breathless star, Jean Seberg (Kristen Stewart), who in the late 1960s was targeted by the FBI because of her support of the civil rights movement and romantic involvement with Hakim Jamal (Anthony Mackie), among others. In Benedict Andrews’ noir-ish thriller, Seberg’s life and career are destroyed by Hoover’s overreaching surveillance and harassment in an effort to suppress and discredit Seberg’s activism."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829576/","name":"Kristen Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040939/","name":"Yvan Attal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9982380/","name":"Gabriel Sky"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4970700/","name":"Benedict Andrews"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689788/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0650540/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323227/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1100123/","name":"Joe Shrapnel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3143608/","name":"Anna Waterhouse"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

Horizon Line
programme.desc:
Braveheart: Directed by Mel Gibson. With James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo. Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112573/","name":"Braveheart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMmU0YTYtOWM3My00YzBmLWI0YzctOGYyNTkwMWE5MTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001526/","name":"Patrick McGoohan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000700/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042559/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078539/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908824/","name":"Randall Wallace"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2874063641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"1995-05-24","description":"Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.","keywords":"scotland,revolt,legend,secret marriage,based on true story","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112573/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"heisenberg12"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a Masterpiece. Best Movie of All Time","reviewBody":"Braveheart is the best movie ever made in history, an absolute sculpted work of art that depicts every emotion of human existence, from suffering, to courage to love, in front of the background of political astuteness and socio-hierarchal analysis.

Telling the quasi-true story of one man's conviction and courage to exact vengeance for the killing of his first wife and father at the hands of the ruthless King Edward the II of England, who in turn inspires his small province of Scotland to rebel and go to war in a real fight for freedom and independence, Braveheart is a stunning depiction of the capacity of the human spirit to overcome the odds, defy tyranny, and achieve justice, respect, and dignity against oppression.

Although its retractors and critics will dwell and harp on the historical accuracy of some of the movie, particularly what part Robert the Bruce played in real life, there is no denying the true power and emotional influence of this movie. It's understandable, particularly for Europeans, how this could be problematic due to their upbringing in studying history, but the movie is not really about being historically perfect; it's a work of art about things much deeper. A documentary it is not, and it's duplistic and hypocritical for the film's haters to dwell on this minor detail, but perhaps allow historical rewriting to slide and give it a free pass in something like Tarantino's Inglourious Basterds or Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.

On this topic, one of the dozens of best parts in the movie is when Robert the Bruce plays an important role in one of the battles, and eventually the movie does come around and get Robert's history back on track with more accuracy as to his part and character in the battle for Scotland's independence.

Without trying to get the history perfect, this movie is simply flawless. It's beyond flawless, really. A flawless movie can just be a technical masterpiece with very little power, but the raw power and emotion coming off the screen in practically every single scene in Braveheart is like an inferno.

James Horner's score is one of the greatest scores ever for any movie, and it successfully enhances the drama and emotion of each scene, without coming across as manipulative. It fits perfectly into every single scene it is used.

There isn't one acting role that is not well-done. This is one of Gibson's best acting roles, and the guy who plays Edward II gives an outstanding performance.

This is the greatest epic movie ever created in the history of Hollywood. A few years later, another great modern epic Gladiator came out and drew rightful comparisons to Braveheart, but while Gladiator is a very good movie, it lacks in the emotional depth, power, and ultimate inspiration behind the experience of watching Braveheart.

The final Act of Braveheart is one of the most powerful ever put on film. As a first time viewer, you really have no idea where the story is going to go (even as a repeat viewer it still holds weight). To this day, there is still nothing like it. Just when you think it's over or you know how it will end, it just continues to twist and turn, and then it closes with what is probably the best ending of any movie in history.

In addition to all of this, the body of Braveheart is loaded with outstanding battle scenes, incredible editing, and great dialogue rooted in inspiration, political strategy, philosophy, and stunning human experience of love, desire, passion, suffering, and identity.

When you look at the top rated movies on IMDB, it is laughable that comic book movies and good popcorn-fun movies are actually rated above this. This is without a doubt, hands down, one of the top 25 movies ever made, and in my opinion, it is the #1 best movie of all-time.

This movie is a masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":979631,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"duration":"PT2H58M"}</script><metacontent="

La Gomera
programme.desc: La gomera: Directed by Corneliu Porumboiu. With Vlad Ivanov, Catrinel Marlon, Rodica Lazar, Sabin Tambrea. Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7921248/","name":"La gomera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI4MjM1NTctMmQwYy00ZDE3LTllOTAtODRlNjJkMTg1MDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Not everything is as it seems for Cristi, a policeman who plays both sides of the law. Embarking with the beautiful Gilda on a high-stakes heist, both will have to navigate the twists and turns of corruption, treachery and deception.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7921248/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"RodrigAndrisan"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A special Romanian film!","reviewBody":"It's actually a co-production, but mostly Romanian. I could say is the first Romanian film made intelligently, for international distribution. Of course, it's not a masterpiece, by far, but, compared to the previous level of Romanian films, it's a great qualitative leap. Vlad Ivanov, the lead, is almost an expressionless actor. I can't say the same about Catrinel Marlon, she is very expressive, dressed and undressed. Talented and very beautiful, a face reminiscent of Penelope Cruz and Nastassja Kinski, Catrinel Marlon I hope she'll become a great actress. Very convincing Rodica Lazar in the role of the very annoying prosecutor. The rest of the cast is good, the movie is worth to be seen. Porumboiu surpasses himself from one film to another. I wish him to keep it that way, higher and higher.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4950,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-09-13","keywords":"female rear nudity,canary islands,police detective,policeman,police officer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1044168473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIyOWU0MWYtY2IzZS00ZWMwLThkMDgtYWU5MDA2MjVmMWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIyOWU0MWYtY2IzZS00ZWMwLThkMDgtYWU5MDA2MjVmMWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412096/","name":"Vlad Ivanov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5054840/","name":"Catrinel Marlon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120715/","name":"Rodica Lazar"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1717949/","name":"Corneliu Porumboiu"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0180401/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167020/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0245364/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1717949/","name":"Corneliu Porumboiu"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Foals - Rip Up the Road
programme.desc: Rok z życia muzyków z zespołu Foals, luminarzy brytyjskiej sceny indierockowej. Kamera śledzi artystów podczas światowej trasy koncertowej, obejmującej dwa słynne występy w Alexandra Palace w Londynie. Było to niezwykle intensywne dwanaście miesięcy w ich karierze. Twórcy ukazują codzienną pracę artystów i towarzyszące jej emocje.

programme.title: The Book Thief
Złodziejka książek
The Book Thief
programme.desc:
The Book Thief: Directed by Brian Percival. With Roger Allam, Sophie Nélisse, Heike Makatsch, Julian Lehmann. While subjected to the horrors of World War II Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. In the basement of her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0816442/","name":"The Book Thief","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE3NzkyMjAyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDc5MTE0MDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4563869/","name":"Sophie Nélisse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001691/","name":"Geoffrey Rush"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001833/","name":"Emily Watson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093053/","name":"Brian Percival"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0226011/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420822/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2295691/","name":"Markus Zusak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0678104/","name":"Michael Petroni"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi467773465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIxODA2OTI2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI0Nzg0MDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzIxODA2OTI2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI0Nzg0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While subjected to the horrors of WWII Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. Under the stairs in her home, a Jewish refuge is being sheltered by her adoptive parents. "},"datePublished":"2014-01-22","description":"While subjected to the horrors of World War II Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. In the basement of her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents.","keywords":"book,world war two,nazi,nazi germany,book burning","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0816442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ryzah"},"dateCreated":"2014-02-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't listen to the poor reviews.","reviewBody":"Orange Wednesday's are a weekly escape from the monotony of the working world (New Teacher - Little money - Stressed - Used to do absolutely nothing at Uni). Therefore over the last couple of years, as you can imagine, the cinema has been overused and a plethora of films have been watched, reviewed and loved. Being a sap myself and an ability to completely immerse myself within a movie; the usual comment coming out of the cinema is: "That was the best film I've ever seen!"...

Obviously that is never actually true, and probably isn't for this film, however I again came out the cinema saying the same thing. Within the first two months of this year: Wolf of Wall Street, 12 Years a Slave, American Hustle and Dallas Buyers Club...Now The Book Thief! 

Now I had no idea what the film was about before stepping in the cinema, except a girl who steals books in the war. Even half way through I thought this film was a heart warming film about the war through a child's eyes. I was WRONG! If you know nothing about the story, the film is beautifully written, acted, portrayed (Life of Pi creators, done it again) and has bags of shocks, emotion and heartache. The other lad who viewed the film with me(In the same boat work wise) I have never seen cry. That man was broken!

The young actress, is going to be a superstar. Geoffrey Rush, although portrayed a "Disney Dad" as some reviewers suggested; was inspirational and perfectly cast, when compared to the book, which I have now read.

Another reviewer trashed the use of "bits of German" - You sir, are a fool. This is not Hollywood tact, the book does exactly the same thing and therefore the film took that same role. 

Another reviewer gave the film "1 star" (Mainly due to the film not being realistic in 3 parts, which all played no real role in the film and therefore a poor point to make) It's a story based on some real life events, not a true story.

Rant over though, this film truly moved me (23 year old male) I know, I hid it well in the cinema! The film is just a Must see and although I probably wouldn't rate it 10 star (I never rate that highly) I felt I needed to raise the profile, due to people who have too much time on their hands to pick holes in minor parts of films and have to have their films more like a documentary, then a masterpiece for all warps of life and ages.

I will be using this in school as soon as it is out and will be a fantastic tool for developing writing!

Cracking film!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":129372,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fourmi
Mój mały mistrz
Fourmi
programme.desc:
Fourmi: Directed by Julien Rappeneau. With François Damiens, Maleaume Paquin, André Dussollier, Ludivine Sagnier. Théo would like to give some hope to his father, Laurent, a lonely alcoholic and disillusioned with life. The opportunity comes when Théo is about to be signed by Arsenal FC." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9767556/","name":"Fourmi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0MjFiM2EtNmIxMy00NjIwLWFiNjctOTAxODBkMTNlZDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Théo would like to give some hope to his father, Laurent, a lonely alcoholic and disillusioned with life. The opportunity comes when Théo is about to be signed by Arsenal FC.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9767556/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lie can save a human wreck.","reviewBody":"François Damiens is the stand out ,in his portrayal of a man,Laurent , who has lost everything ,even the custody of his only child, a teenage whiz kid ;considering the limitations he's working under,he's to be commended : the divorced man ,whose wife started a new life with a well-respected man who tries to win the boy's affection,a brat who has only eyes for his dad who of course sank into alcoholism ,it is a cliché to end all the clichés.

Laurent is really a poor pitiful man whose son's gift for football is his only reason to cling to life ;he's even become persona non grata on the football field,and,supreme vexation, he's denied to attend his boy's last game. Although he was not selected by the Arsenal FC recruiter ,Theo makes his father believe he is actually about to sign to the prestigious club.

Overnight ,helped by a devoted social worker , the overwrought man changes : he will find a job, he will learn English with a walkman and cassettes ( is it still used ?says the social worker), and ,last but not least ,he will quit drinking (a few relapses will happen). "Fourmi " (=ant;the football wizard is too short to be signed to Arsenal )is the story of a redemption.Theo knows that ,if he does not qualify for the selection,his father's life is irreparably doomed ;so he's compelled to lie to his coach (André Dussolier) and his assistant (who seems to prefer pastry cook to football,so do I).

Only his good friend,Karim is in secret ;as for the youngsters ' performances ,it's uneven :it goes from good (Laurent,Karim) to mediocre (Max ,the computer wizzard :how could you believe this giddy jerk would be able to write an email using the perfect club jargon,? the young actor acts as if he does not care)

The subject of the movie is a man's redemption ;it renders the denouement null and void ,a crowd-pleaser ,the expected event ; the movie would have been a hundred times more convincing without it , and reductio ad aburdum that a lie can be vital to save a human life .And that a man can help himself ,and ,after a while does not need his son's prowesses to be a human being again ( the bedroom he paints for him speaks volumes about his metamorphosis).And Mr Damiens was up to scratch!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":294,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-09-04","keywords":"alcoholic,competition,boy,fraud,father son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

Elephants","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1397594649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MzA4MjYxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzc1NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MzA4MjYxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzc1NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A veterinary student (Robert Pattinson) abandons his studies after his parents are killed and joins a traveling circus as their vet, where he meets animal trainer August (Christoph Waltz) and his wife Marlena (Reese Witherspoon)."},"datePublished":"2011-04-22","description":"Set in the 1930s, a former veterinary student takes a job in a travelling circus and falls in love with the ringmaster's wife.","keywords":"animal abuse,circus,elephant,ringmaster,train","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1067583/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GlimmerBunny"},"dateCreated":"2011-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"A truly spectacular movie!","reviewBody":"OK, I'll try to tell you a bit of what I thought about "Water for Elephants", without spoiling anything. I have not read the novel (even though I plan to do it now) so I'm only offering my views on the movie.

First of all: It's amazingly beautiful. The costumes and sets are gorgeous, the cinematography is exquisite, the animals are cute (especially Rosie the elephant) and the three leads are very easy on the eyes as well. 

Robert Pattinson was actually quite good. This was a surprise to me, since I didn't really think he was anything special in any of the Twilight movies or "Remember Me". He looked very appropriate for the time the movie was set in, and even though I love Emile Hirsch (who auditioned for Jacob too) I'm confident that Robert was the best choice there was for this role, it was perfect for him. Hal Holbrook was also very fitting for the role of older Jacob. The two actors really made me believe that they were the same person in different stages of his life.

Reese Witherspoon was okay. She looked beautiful, was charming and cute but it felt like something was missing - however, I can't think of any other actress I would have liked better in the role, so I came to the conclusion that it was probably the character Marlena that was a little bland, not Reese. 

But the true star of this movie was Christoph Waltz. I may be a bit biased since I loved him in "Inglorious Basterds", but he was even more perfect in this movie. His portrayal of August was amazing, he made him likable and interesting and I was always compelled by his scenes. The character reminded me a lot of Miles in "King Kong" (played by Jack Black), a character that also wanted fame and success more than anything and used questionable and even cruel methods to get it. He was terrifying in some scenes too, but always believable. Also, in the beginning of the movie i really felt the chemistry between August and Marlena, which made the character even more interesting; however, I did feel like Jacob and Marlena had chemistry too, and in my opinion this way it was more realistic (both men loved her and she also cared about both of them). 

I loved the movie, and I really recommend it to everyone. I would sincerely give it 10/10 stars. Of course there was some parts of the movie I didn't like (particularly towards the end of it), but overall it was a magical, spectacular and epic period movie, and I can't wait to see it again!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":112523,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="
